column5: Dispite the thunder storm warning yesterday, and reading all the posts about getting struck by lightning, I drove to the Grand River for some shore fishing yesterday. The weather was perfect, cloudy, not too windy and not a single drop of rain. I fished for 5 hours and caught 3 nice catfish,(3-5lb) 1 silverbass that weight almost a pound, and a nice walleye I kept for dinner.      22" 3.12lb I found a tag on the fish, is there a website I can enter the 6 digit codes?  If anyone's interested I would love to meet some of the Grand River area OFNers, there's a lot to learn about the river as this was my 2nd visite.
Great report and pics y_o  Thanks for sharing Leechman
Sounds like a good fishing day! Those cats are great to catch! And a bonus pickerel!! Thanks for sharing.
You must have a mother of a net to land those cats there!
sounds like a nice day from shore. Thanks for sharing.
nice report.  i have a personal vendetta against the grand
That is too funny....you will get your revenge....and when you do, it will be sweet!
